meanings.definition: A red light at the rear of a vehicle.
meanings.sent1: The taillight on the car glowed brightly in the dark night.
meanings.sent2: When driving at night, it is important to have functioning taillights.
meanings.sent3: The taillight winked playfully as the car came to a stop.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a taillight, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The taillight stood out like a beacon, guiding us through the fog.

meanings.definition: The light at the rear of a vehicle that illuminates when the brakes are applied.
meanings.sent1: As the driver pressed the brake pedal, the taillight lit up.
meanings.sent2: Make sure your taillight is working properly to signal when you slow down.
meanings.sent3: The taillight blushed every time the brakes were used.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a taillight, shining brighter in moments of joy.
meanings.sent5: The taillight flickered like a heartbeat, pulsing with each brake application.

meanings.definition: A light on the back of a vehicle that is used to signal other drivers.
meanings.sent1: The taillight blinked to indicate a turn to the following cars.
meanings.sent2: Drivers should always use their taillights to communicate with others on the road.
meanings.sent3: The taillight waved goodbye as the car turned off the street.
meanings.sent4: His words were a taillight, guiding her through the tough decision.
meanings.sent5: The taillight danced like a firefly, catching the attention of those behind.
